sen.j: 龍源院（りょうげんいん）は京都府京都市北区 (京都市)紫野にある、臨済宗大本山大徳寺の塔頭（たっちゅう）である。
sen.e: Ryogen-in Temple is a sub-temple within the precinct of Rinzai sect Daihonzan (Head Temple) Daitoku-ji Templee located in Murasakino, Kita Ward, Kyoto City, Kyoto Prefecture.
Ryogen-in Temple is a sub-temple within the precinct of Rinzai sect Daihonzan (Head Temple) Daitoku-ji Templee located in Murasakino, Kita Ward, Kyoto City, Kyoto Prefecture.
Ryogen-in Temple is a sub-temple within the precinct of Rinzai sect Daihonzan (Head Temple) Daitoku-ji Temple located in Murasakino, Kita Ward, Kyoto City, Kyoto Prefecture.

sen.j: 大仙院を本庵とする大徳寺北派に対して、南派の本庵とされている。
sen.e: It is the main temple of the Southern lineage of Daitoku-ji Temple whereas Daisen-in Temple is the main temple of the Northern lineage of Daitoku-ji Temple.
It is the main temple of the Southern lineage of Daitoku-ji Temple whereas Daisen-in Temple is the main temple of the Northern lineage of Daitoku-ji Temple.
It is the main temple of the Southern lineage of Daitoku-ji Temple whereas Daisen-in Temple is the main temple of the Northern lineage of Daitoku-ji Temple.

sen.j: 文亀2年(1502年)に東渓宗牧（とうけいそうぼく）を開山として、能登国の畠山義元・豊後国の大友義長らが創建。
sen.e: Ryogen-in Temple was founded in 1502 by Yoshimoto HATAKEYAMA of Noto Province and Yoshinaga OTOMO of Bungo Province who named Tokei Soboku as founding priest.
Ryogen-in Temple was founded in 1502 by Yoshimoto HATAKEYAMA of Noto Province and Yoshinaga OTOMO of Bungo Province who named Tokei Soboku as founding priest.
Ryogen-in Temple was founded in 1502 by Yoshimoto HATAKEYAMA of Noto Province and Yoshinaga OTOMO of Bungo Province who named Tokei Soboku as founding priest.

sen.j: 明治の初めに神仏分離により大阪・住吉神社内の慈恩寺と岐阜・高山城主だった金森長近が大徳寺内に建立した金竜院を合併した。
sen.e: Due to the separation of Buddhism and Shinto during the early Meiji era, the temple merged with Jion-ji Temple in the grounds of Sumiyoshi-jinja Shrine in Osaka and Konryu-in Temple constructed in the precinct of Daitoku-ji Temple by Nagachika KANAMORI, lord of Takayama Castle in Gifu.

Due to the separation of Buddhism and Shinto during the early Meiji era, the temple merged with Jion-ji Temple in the grounds of Sumiyoshi-jinja Shrine in Osaka and Konryu-in Temple constructed in the precinct of Daitoku-ji Temple by Nagachika KANAMORI, lord of Takayama Castle in Gifu.

Due to the separation of Buddhism and Shinto during the early Meiji period, the temple merged with Jion-ji Temple in the grounds of Sumiyoshi-jinja Shrine in Osaka and Konryu-in Temple constructed in the precinct of Daitoku-ji Temple by Nagachika KANAMORI, lord of Takayama-jo Castle in Gifu.
sen.cmt: 時代用語統一城用語統一

sen.j: 大徳寺の山号である龍宝山（りゅうほうざん）の「龍」と中国・臨済宗松源派の祖・松源崇岳（しょうげんすうがく）の禅を正しく継承する松源一脈の「源」の2文字を採ったものである。
sen.e: The temple's name is formed from the "ryu" character of "Ryohozan", the honorific mountain prefix of Daitoku-ji Temple, and the "gen" character of Songyuan Chongyue ('Shogen Sugaku' in Japanese), the founder of the Shogen lineage of the Rinzai Sect in China.

The temple's name is formed from the "ryu" character of "Ryohozan", the honorific mountain prefix of Daitoku-ji Temple, and the "gen" character of Songyuan Chongyue ('Shogen Sugaku' in Japanese), the founder of the Shogen lineage of the Rinzai Sect in China.

The temple's name is formed from the 'ryu' character of 'Ryohozan,' the sango (literally, "mountain name"), which is the title prefixed to the name of a Buddhist temple, of Daitoku-ji Temple, and the 'gen' character of Shogen Ichimyaku who was the pure successor of Zen deriving from Songyuan Chongyue ('Shogen Sugaku' in Japanese), the founder of the Shogen lineage of the Rinzai Sect in China.
sen.cmt: "→'原文に即して訳を記載しました。

sen.j: 本堂（方丈、重要文化財）
sen.e: Main Hall (Abbot's Quarters, Important Cultural Property)
Main Hall (Abbot's Quarters, Important Cultural Property)
Main Hall (Abbot's Quarters, Important Cultural Property)

sen.j: 室町時代の永正14年（1517年）頃に建立された一重入母屋造・檜皮葺の建物。
sen.e: A single storey building topped by a cypress bark hip-and-gable roof constructed in 1517 during the Muromachi period.
A single storey building topped by a cypress bark hip-and-gable roof constructed in 1517 during the Muromachi period.
A single storey building topped by a cypress bark hip-and-gable roof constructed in 1517 during the Muromachi period.

sen.j: 日本の方丈建築としては古例の一つである。
sen.e: It is one of the oldest examples of hojo architecture in Japan.
It is one of the oldest examples of hojo architecture in Japan.
It is one of the oldest examples of hojo architecture in Japan.

sen.j: 室中（しっちゅう）襖絵の龍図は、作者や制作年代は不明だが，桃山～江戸時代の作といわれている。
sen.e: Both the date and artist of the paintings of dragons on the sliding panels in the inner room are unknown but they are reputed to date from between the Momoyama and Edo periods.
Both the date and artist of the paintings of dragons on the sliding panels in the inner room are unknown but they are reputed to date from between the Momoyama and Edo periods.
Both the date and artist of the paintings of dragons on the sliding panels in the inner room are unknown but they are reputed to date from between the Momoyama and Edo periods.

sen.j: 玄関（重要文化財）
sen.e: Entrance Hall (Important Cultural Property)
Entrance Hall (Important Cultural Property)
Entrance Hall (Important Cultural Property)

sen.j: 本堂（方丈）へと至る切妻造・檜皮葺の玄関で、本堂と同時代に建立された。
sen.e: A cypress bark hip-and-gable roof-topped entrance hall leading into the main hall (abbot's quarters) and dating from the same time as the main hall.
A cypress bark hip-and-gable roof-topped entrance hall leading into the main hall (abbot's quarters) and dating from the same time as the main hall.
A cypress bark hip-and-gable roof-topped entrance hall leading into the main hall (abbot's quarters) and dating from the same time as the main hall.

sen.j: 表門（重要文化財）
sen.e: Front Gate
Front Gate
Front Gate (Important Cultural Property)

sen.j: 切妻造・桧皮葺の四脚門で、方丈・唐門と同時代に建立された。
sen.e: A cypress bark gable roof four-legged gate that was constructed at the same time as the abbot's quarters and karamon gate.
A cypress bark gable roof four-legged gate that was constructed at the same time as the abbot's quarters and karamon gate.
A cypress bark gable roof four-legged gate that was constructed at the same time as the abbot's quarters and karamon gate.

sen.j: 開祖堂
sen.e: Kaiso-do Hall
Kaiso-do Hall
Kaiso-do Hall

sen.j: 開祖・東渓禅師の塔所となっている一重入母屋造り・檜皮葺きの建物で、南北朝・鎌倉・室町初期時代の唐様式の粋を取り入れた昭和の代表作である。
sen.e: This cypress bark hip-and-gable roof building that serves as the burial place of founder Tokei Zenshi is a representative example of a Showa era structure incorporating the Chinese Tang Dynasty style of the Northern and Southern Courts, Kamakura and early Muromachi periods.

This cypress bark hip-and-gable roof building that serves as the burial place of founder Tokei Zenshi is a representative example of a Showa era structure incorporating the Chinese Tang Dynasty style of the Northern and Southern Courts, Kamakura and early Muromachi periods.

This cypress bark hip-and-gable roof building that serves as the burial place of founder Tokei Zenshi is a representative example of a Showa period structure incorporating the Chinese Tang Dynasty style of the Northern and Southern Courts, Kamakura and early Muromachi periods.

sen.j: 東滴壺（とうてきこ）
sen.e: Totekiko Garden
Totekiko Garden
Totekiko Garden

sen.j: 昭和35年（1960年）に作庭された方丈と庫裏との間の現代壺庭の傑作で、白砂敷きのなかに5つの石が3・2の石組みに分けて配されている。
sen.e: A wonderful modern courtyard garden created between the abbot's quarters and kuri (food preparation building) that features five stones placed on white sand in a 3/2 arrangement.
A wonderful modern courtyard garden created between the abbot's quarters and kuri (food preparation building) that features five stones placed on white sand in a 3/2 arrangement.
A wonderful modern courtyard garden created between the abbot's quarters and kuri (food preparation building) that features five stones placed on white sand in a 3/2 arrangement.

sen.j: 一枝坦（いっしだん）
sen.e: Isshidan Garden
Isshidan Garden
Isshidan Garden

sen.j: 東渓禅師が師である実伝和尚から賜った「霊山一枝之軒（りょうぜんいっしのけん）」という室号から名づけられたもので、丸く象った苔の中に石が立つ亀島が印象的な斬新な庭である。
sen.e: This original garden was named after the room name "Ryozen Isshino ken" granted by Jitsuden Osho, a disciple of Tokei Zenshi, and features an impressive stone tortoise-island in a circular moss arrangement.

This original garden was named after the room name "Ryozen Isshino ken" granted by Jitsuden Osho, a disciple of Tokei Zenshi, and features an impressive stone tortoise-island in a circular moss arrangement.

This original garden was named after the room name 'Ryozen Isshino ken' granted by Jitsuden Osho, a disciple of Tokei Zenshi, and features an impressive stone tortoise-island in a circular moss arrangement.

sen.j: 龍吟庭（りょうぎんてい）
sen.e: Ryogintei Garden
Ryogintei Garden
Ryogintei Garden

sen.j: 方丈北側に広がる三尊石組からなる室町時代の枯山水庭園で、中央の石組は須弥山を表し，青々とした杉苔は洋々たる大海を表わす。
sen.e: A Muromachi style dry landscape garden on the northern side of the abbot's quarters featuring a Buddhist triad stone arrangement in which the central stone symbolizes Mount Meru and the bright green hair-moss represents the ocean.

A Muromachi style dry landscape garden on the northern side of the abbot's quarters featuring a Buddhist triad stone arrangement in which the central stone symbolizes Mount Meru and the bright green hair-moss represents the ocean.

A Muromachi style dry landscape garden on the northern side of the abbot's quarters featuring a Buddhist triad stone arrangement in which the central stone symbolizes Mount Meru and the bright green hair-moss represents the ocean.

sen.j: 滹沱庭（こだてい）
sen.e: Kodatei Garden
Kodatei Garden
Kodatei Garden

sen.j: 宗祖・臨済禅師が住した中国・鎮州城の南を流れる滹沱河から名付けられた白砂の庭で、阿吽の石と名付けられた２つの石は聚楽第の遺構といわれる。
sen.e: A white sand garden named after China's Hutuo ('Koda' in Japanese) River that flows to the south Zhenzhou Castle in which Rinzai Sect founder Linji resided featuring two stones named "Aun-no-Ishi" that are said to be the remains of Jurakudai.

A white sand garden named after China's Hutuo ('Koda' in Japanese) River that flows to the south Zhenzhou Castle in which Rinzai Sect founder Linji resided featuring two stones named "Aun-no-Ishi" that are said to be the remains of Jurakudai.

A white sand garden named after China's Hutuo ('Koda' in Japanese) River that flows to the south of Zhenzhou Castle in which Rinzai Sect founder Linji resided featuring two stones named "Aun-no-Ishi" that are said to be the remains of Jurakudai.

sen.j: 龍源院の創建より古い鎌倉時代の作で、建長2年（1250年）、行心作の銘がある。
sen.e: A Kamakura period statue crafted in 1250 that predates the founding of Ryogen-in Temple and carries the inscription "created by Gyoshin".

sen.j: 京都八釈迦のひとつに数えられる。
sen.e: It is considered to be one of the Eight Great Shaka Statues of Kyoto.

sen.j: 2幅で一対となっている掛幅で、長谷川等伯が描いたものと伝わる。

sen.j: 中国禅宗の祖である達磨を描いたもので、徳川幕府の御用絵師だった狩野探幽が描いた。
sen.e: A painting of Bodhidharma, the founder of Chinese Zen Buddhism, painted by Tanyu KANO who was a painter in the service of the Tokugawa Shogunate.

sen.j: 天正11年(1583年)の銘により日本最古の種子島銃といわれる。
sen.e: Said to be the oldest Tanegashima arquebus in Japan due to the inscription dating it at 1583.
Said to be the oldest Tanegashima arquebus in Japan due to the inscription dating it at 1583.

sen.j: 四方蒔絵碁盤・碁筒

sen.j: 豊臣秀吉と徳川家康が対局したと伝わる。
sen.e: Said to have been used by Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI and Ieyasu TOKUGAWA.
Said to have been used by Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI and Ieyasu TOKUGAWA.

sen.j: JR京都駅より京都市バス・大徳寺前（約30分）下車、徒歩
sen.e: Take the Kyoto City Bus from JR Kyoto Station to "Daitoku-ji mae" bus stop and walk.
